I was so disappointing and for the money I spent, the acai being partly completely frozen with huge ice chips in it was unacceptable.

I‚Äôve had many a Acai bowl before but this one, aside from the really fresh and beautifully cut fruit, left me very disappointed in the Playa Bowl experience. text:
Had an acai bowl. Okay, but too sweet... You can definitely tell there is added sugar. The granola is also very sweet... Way too much sugar. Eating the bowl was like a sugar bomb. It is not surprising to me because I did ask a worker how the different bowl bases are made (was specifically asking what the mango base was blended with): she told me she didn't know as none of the bowl bases are made on site, they all come as a pre-made mix. The acai bowl definitely tastes this way-- added sugar, preservatives, not fresh. I would definitely skip the honey topping next time because there was already too much sugar.

My comparator is SoBol, my regular place (tried Playa Bowls because they were closed). Sobol's acai and other bowls are blended fresh on site, made to order, and sweetened with apple juice. You can absolutely tell the difference in the taste and freshness... In fact, sometimes if I want a Sobol acai bowl a little on the sweeter side I have to request extra honey or agave.

Of note, Playa Bowls wins on selection. The menu is huge. Including steel cut oatmeal bowls which I would like to try. But all the frozen bowls just taste like artificial desserts. I sampled the mango bowl and it was SOOO sweet, and really did not taste natural and fresh at all.

SUMMARY: Okay place for an acai bowl, bowls have added sugar, ask for honey / agave on the side or skip all together. SoBol is a far superior choice for an acai bowl, and pricing is pretty much identical. Playa Bowls has a much bigger menu, so if you crave an acai bowl alternative (e.g. frozen mango base, green base, oatmeal)-- you may prefer it.

Happy Acai-ing!

text: Wow Wow Wow Wow Wow Wow........... I'm not one to write reviews for literally anything, but I have to document my experience that I had today at Playa Bowls.  I haven't heard much of this place before today, so I didn't know what to expect going into this place, but man was I pleasantly surprised.  I was immediately greeted by the cozy beach aesthetic of the establishment, I can see why they call it PLAYA Bowls haha!!!  The only bad part about it was not being able to stay to eat at this exquisite place, as I had gotten my order for takeout.  As I was walking up to the counter I was greeted by the two nicest people I have ever met in the city, Hannah and Kira!  They were extremely knowledgable on the history of the establishment and the city as well, so keeping a conversation wasn't a problem at all.  They made me feel so welcome, like it was my second home.  They greeted me, kindly took my order, and sat me down at my table which is everything a customer could ask for!  While I was patiently waiting for my order, I had great conversations with the two employees that made the waiting worth it!!  The couple minutes that it took to make my complex bowl felt like mere seconds went by, it was a magical experience.  As I was leaving I started to feel somewhat sad, since this place quickly felt like home.  I was surprised at how this place made me feel so welcome to the point where I didn't want to leave!  I would truly recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a quick bite of something fresh and exciting in the city. Infinity out of 10!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I will be coming back MANY more times.
Recommended dishes: Custom Acai Bowl- Includes Granola TPD
